meanings.sent1: She effaced the mistake on the whiteboard.
meanings.sent2: The rain effaced the footprints on the muddy path.
meanings.sent3: Trying to efface the embarrassing memory, she focused on happier thoughts.
meanings.sent4: The artist effaced the old mural to create space for a new masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The wind and rain worked together to efface the writing on the ancient stone tablet.

meanings.definition: To make oneself inconspicuous or humble
meanings.sent1: Feeling shy, she effaced herself in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent2: He always tried to efface his achievements and let others take the spotlight.
meanings.sent3: In an attempt to efface herself, she wore plain clothes and avoided eye contact.
meanings.sent4: The humble leader effaced his own needs to prioritize the well-being of his team.
meanings.sent5: The small bird effaced itself among the leaves, blending in perfectly with its surroundings.
